description: From Middle English congelen, from Middle French congeler, from Latin congelare, cognate with Portuguese and Spanish congelar.

verbs.description: congeal (third-person singular simple present congeals, present participle congealing, simple past and past participle congealed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To change from a liquid to solid state, perhaps due to cold; called to freeze in nontechnical usage.
(transitive) To coagulate, make curdled or semi-solid such as gel or jelly.

examples: We must act before opposition to our plans congeals.
